Module jGame
Package jGame.core.utils

Class MathUtils

java.lang.Object
jGame.core.utils.MathUtils
public final class MathUtils
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides a set of utility Math methods that can be potentially useful in game logic.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Nuno Pereira

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static interface  MathUtils.ReduceLambda
    Represents an operation that can be applied to 2 numbers.

    • clamp0

      @Deprecated public static int clamp0​(int number, int min, int max)
      Deprecated.
      use clamp() instead (method names changed to keep compatibility, the algorithm is the thing that changed, decreasing computation interval)
      Clamps a number to the fit between a certain range of numbers
      Parameters:
      number - the value to clamp
      min - the minimum value number can take;
      max - the maximum value number can take;
      Returns:
      the clamped value of number
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      Math.max(int, int), Math.min(int, int)

    • map

      @Deprecated public static float map​(int number, int originMin, int originMax, int destinyMin, int destinyMax) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Deprecated.
      due to non-floating nature, slopes would be calculated in integer form and lead to wrong results
      Maps a value between a certain range to another, different range. This methods clamps the value to the origin range but still throws an exception if attempting to map a value that's outside of the origin range.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to get mapped
      originMin - the minimum value number can (and must) take
      originMax - the maximum value number can (and must) take
      destinyMin - the minimum value that the output can take
      destinyMax - the maximum value that the output can take
      Returns:
      the new value, mapped from the origin range to the destiny range
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value isn't in the "origin" range
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      clamp(int, int, int)

    • map

      @Deprecated public static float map​(long number, long originMin, long originMax, long destinyMin, long destinyMax) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Deprecated.
      due to non-floating nature, slopes would be calculated in integer form and lead to wrong results
      Maps a value between a certain range to another, different range. This methods clamps the value to the origin range but still throws an exception if attempting to map a value that's outside of the origin range.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to get mapped
      originMin - the minimum value number can (and must) take
      originMax - the maximum value number can (and must) take
      destinyMin - the minimum value that the output can take
      destinyMax - the maximum value that the output can take
      Returns:
      the new value, mapped from the origin range to the destiny range
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value isn't in the "origin" range
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      clamp(long, long, long)

    • map

      public static float map​(float number, float originMin, float originMax, float destinyMin, float destinyMax) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Maps a value between a certain range to another, different range. This methods clamps the value to the origin range but still throws an exception if attempting to map a value that's outside of the origin range.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to get mapped
      originMin - the minimum value number can (and must) take
      originMax - the maximum value number can (and must) take
      destinyMin - the minimum value that the output can take
      destinyMax - the maximum value that the output can take
      Returns:
      the new value, mapped from the origin range to the destiny range
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value isn't in the "origin" range
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      clamp(float, float, float)

    • map

      public static double map​(double number, double originMin, double originMax, double destinyMin, double destinyMax) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Maps a value between a certain range to another, different range. This methods clamps the value to the origin range but still throws an exception if attempting to map a value that's outside of the origin range. Due to variable typing, this method returns a double instead of a float.
      Parameters:
      number - the number to get mapped
      originMin - the minimum value number can (and must) take
      originMax - the maximum value number can (and must) take
      destinyMin - the minimum value that the output can take
      destinyMax - the maximum value that the output can take
      Returns:
      the new value, mapped from the origin range to the destiny range
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value isn't in the "origin" range
      Since:
      1.0.0
      See Also:
      clamp(double, double, double)

    • reduce

      public static java.lang.Number reduce​(java.lang.Number[] nums, MathUtils.ReduceLambda reduceFunc)
      Inspired by Python's built-in 'reduce' function. Reduce an array of numbers to a single value, according to the specified function passed in.
      Parameters:
      nums - the array of numbers to reduce
      reduceFunc - the function to apply when reducing the array
      Returns:
      a value corresponding to the reduced array
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • reduce

      public static java.lang.Number reduce​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Number> nums, MathUtils.ReduceLambda reduceFunc)
      Inspired by Python's built-in 'reduce' function. Reduce a collection of numbers to a single value, according to the specified function passed in.
      Parameters:
      nums - the collection of numbers to reduce
      reduceFunc - the function to apply when reducing the array
      Returns:
      a value corresponding to the reduced array
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • reduce

      public static java.lang.Number reduce​(java.lang.Number startValue, java.lang.Number[] nums, MathUtils.ReduceLambda reduceFunc)
      Inspired by Python's built-in 'reduce' function. Reduce an array of numbers to a single value, using an initial value, according to the specified function passed in.
      Parameters:
      startValue - the initial value
      nums - the array of numbers to reduce
      reduceFunc - the function to apply when reducing the array
      Returns:
      a value corresponding to the reduced array
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • reduce

      public static java.lang.Number reduce​(java.lang.Number startValue, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Number> nums, MathUtils.ReduceLambda reduceFunc)
      Inspired by Python's built-in 'reduce' function. Reduce a collection of numbers to a single value, using an initial value, according to the specified function passed in.
      Parameters:
      startValue - the initial value
      nums - the collection of numbers to reduce
      reduceFunc - the function to apply when reducing the array
      Returns:
      a value corresponding to the reduced array
      Since:
      2.0.0
